Just Toys Classic Cars is proud to present this beautiful 1986 Mercedes Benz 560 SL.  These cars were beautiful when they were new and carry an iconic following with them today.  This car was very expensive in 1986.  If you walked in to a Mercedes dealership you would have seen and MSRP on the window sticker somewhere around $48,200.  This is like buying something for about $108,000 today.  This car still presents very well.  Its red paint gleams from any angle and is just stunning.  This car has the removable hard top that it came with and it is in the same great shape as the rest of the car.  As you will see in the pics, the soft top is a chocolate brown and a very nice accent to the paint.  This is truly a car that you can cruise around in style and still get plenty of looks as you do it.

As we roll in and take a seat in this extremely comfortable, beautiful leather interior, you are going to see that the beauty from the outside carries over to the inside.  This car has been very well maintained and it shows.  The only upgrade has been the AM/FM/CD player and everything else is original from the factory.  If you even wanted to, they make an option to install a small ''jump seat'' in the back with seat belts if you had some younger ones that needed to ride with you.

Now, put that key in and give it a turn and listen to all of that fine German engineering come to life.  This car just purrs like a kitten and is very smooth.  The miles that you see on the odometer are original.  So over the course of this cars 31 year life, it has only had about 2,130 miles a year put on it.  This car isn't even broke in yet.  The 4 speed automatic transmission shifts smooth as glass.  This car gives you that luxury feeling that you are looking for as you roll down the road.  These cars still get a lot of respect.  Still be prepared to get a lot of, waves, thumbs up, and ''hey nice car'' comments.

We just can not say enough how nice this car is.  We offer classic car financing for those that would like to take advantage of the option.  They offer great rates and terms with as little as 10% down.  This way you can get the car of your dreams and you do not have to take all of your cash out of the bank at once.  You can invest that money somewhere else and have your car make you money and your money make you money.  It is the best of both worlds.  You can start that dream by going to www.justtoysclassiccars.com/financing and follow the easy step by step instructions.  We look forward to speaking with you soon, and we look forward to making you the newest member of the Just Toys Classic Cars family.

1988 Mercedes 560 SL Roadster. The 1986-1989 560 series are the last & most advanced of the always popular 107 series cars, with great driving qualities without  being laden with the needless  gadgets  of the 1990 & later cars. This gorgeous example has always been a dry western car, garage kept & sparingly driven  showing  just 95k actual miles, glass smooth brilliant red paint with genuine saddle leather interior, it makes a stunning  presentation. Complete with hard top, owners manuals, tool roll & first aid kit. Just brought in for consignment by owner for the last 12 years. Quality precision German engineering in an appreciating in value model & collectable European sports car for just $25,900
1988 Mercedes-Benz 560SL roadster.

A rare find!!  This is the classic Hollywood convertible driven by the stars!! Painted in bright red, this baby will surely make you stand out in a crowd. Garage kept, this 30 year old beauty is ready to roll. All original with factory stickers in place. No rust!!  Car cover and hard top carrier with wheeels and cover included.  Original owners guide.  Run a car fax or have it inspected. It is all good. The sun is shining and now is the time to enjoy with the top down. Better hurry up  she won't last long.

This 1988 Mercedes 560SL is highly desirable because it's the full wish list in one car.  It's an elegant, powerful, comfortable, timeless, and nimble classic that's presented in a great factory color combo, and has the right late-model upgrades.

Anthracite Gray Metallic is a very special color.  In your garage or at night it will have a look of a gunmetal hue, which is very popular today.  But once the sunlight hits it, the metallic undertones really come to life and give this paint a cosmic charisma. Oh yeah, the Germans understand how to engineer a deep and rich paintjob. But it takes more than precision engineering for a factory paint to retain this much shine 30 years later.  This is a two-owner car, and it has spent nearly that full time under the first owner's care.  You can tell it was his baby by the way the body has remained looking crisp, the straightness of the pinstripes, and how the factory wheels remain mirror-like.  It's the exact kind of presentation you want when you're looking for a cut-above classic convertible.  And that's what a good R107 series Mercedes SL is all about.  This was one of the few well-built convertibles of the era, and so it was the go-to driver for celebrities, dignitaries, and the wealthy.  The sleek lines hid a full size interior and usable trunk that was perfect for any road trip.

The Palomino tan leather interior is the perfect color to contrast the exterior gray while still complementing it.  And this car was meant to look great with the top down, because it's a real driver's grand touring machine.  The dual bucket seats are in great condition and offer a level of all-day comfort that is unmatched in some new convertibles for twice this price.  The 560SL was one of the most expensive cars Mercedes offered during its reign, so the features list is quite long.  This includes desirable conveniences such as power windows, power steering, cruise control, and now an upgraded AM/FM/CD stereo.  Because this was built 1988 there are also more modern features than most R107s, such as a third brake light, driver's airbag, and anti-lock brakes.  It comes with both the folding soft top and a removable hardtop that matches the special exterior paint.  But we know you really want this car for top down fun, and so the air conditioning has been converted to modern R134a to keep you cool while looking cool.

The cleanliness of the engine bay is another great reminder of how well this Mercedes has been treated all its life.  The 560SL is one of the most desirable luxury sportscars of the era because of the power under the hood.  The 5.6-liter V8 was the largest displacement offered, and it was the perfect mix of durability, smoothness, and power.  Plus, when mated to a four-speed automatic transmission with highway-friendly overdrive, this is the vintage Benz that's still a great weekend getaway machine.  But more than just the interstates, this one has a fully independent suspension and four-wheel disc brakes to keep you looking for the back roads.

Complete with owner's manual packet, no other car combines grand touring comfort in a powerful and nimble machine so perfectly.  So when you can find an exceptional example in the best color combo, you know you need to act fast to take it home.  Call today!!!

title: 1987 Mercedes-Benz Gelandewagen Immaculate 300GD Turbo Diesel Survivor !!!

description: 1987 Mercedes-Benz Gelandewagen
This very appealing colour combo
300GD Turbo Diesel
is very well maintained,
very clean and original
car with relatively low milage ( 84k miles) and spent it's whole life in a desert-like environment.
Super nice interior, and even the floor mats show nearly any usage!
The paint is as far as we could see original with only one little touchup !
It runs absolutely nice and is very capable of freeway speeds due to the upgraded 5-speed that lowers your r.p.m.
A very nice survivor indeed, with bare bone technology, no electronics and is bio fuel friendly !
The upgraded Turbo Diesel looks almost like new, and when we upgraded this unit to a Turbo Diesel we overhould the complete engine, all work is professionally done and it now has only
run test miles so it is practically a complete new engine !
Comes with a clean and clear UT title
, inspections are most welcome !
Available in Cedar City, UT.
To find original and unmolested cars is super difficult, so in this case we can truly speak of an exceptional lucky  "Survivor" !
You can find more information, pictures, and inventory on
our website: www.g-mercedes.com
For questions you can also gladly contact me over phone.  Thank you, Johan.

Offered here is a very clean and sharp California 1988 Mercedes 560 SL hardtop-roadster.  The mileage on this car is exceptionally low at 65,313 miles.  The current lady owner is the second owner and pride of ownership is evident.  The car received a professional repaint some time in the past and the finish remains in overall excellent condition with some minor flaws. Sheepskin seat covers were purchased to protect the leather.  The dash shows virtually as-new while many of these cars have scratches and cracks due to age and the environment.  A aftermarket stereo is installed.  The condition of the convertible soft top is unknown since the hardtop has never been removed.  The engine and bay are clean and dry and the car starts and runs flawlessly.  The red exterior with camel interior is an extremely handsome color combination.  560 SL values are trending higher and are now being sought after by collectors and investors.  If you are seeking a 560 SL of this year you have located your car.
I believe whoever takes delivery of this vehicle will be thrilled.
For additional information please phone Dave Henry at 805 705-4924.

Spokemotors.com is not a dealer but a marketing and advertising firm.  The company specializes in assisting owners of classic cars and trucks, sell their vehicles safely on the Internet.  The company physically photographs and videos all vehicles on site.  Be it an individual owner's home, a car collection, storage facility or a museum.
